_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The Realized One's understanding of the: The world has been understood by the Realized One; and he is detached from the world.
The origin of the world has been understood by the Realized One; and he has given up the origin of the world.
The cessation of the world has been understood by the Realized One; and he has realized the cessation of the world.
The practice that leads to the cessation of the world has been understood by the Realized One; and he has developed the practice that leads to the cessation of the world.
He understands everything seen, heard, thought, known, sought, and explored by the mind.
He speaks, says, and expresses only what is real.
He does as he says, and says as he does.
He is the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power.
He is detached from the whole world, disengaged from the whole world.
He is released from all ties and has reached ultimate peace: extinguishment, fearing nothing from any quarter.
He is the Buddha, with defilements ended, untroubled, with doubts cut off.
He has attained the end of all deeds, freed with the end of attachments.
He is the supreme lion, in all the world with its gods, he turns the holy wheel.
The way the gods and humans revere the B: Tamed, he is the best of tamers.
Peaceful, he is the hermit among the peaceful.
Liberated, he is the foremost of liberators.
Crossed over, he is the most excellent of guides across.
